adverbs.description: stably (comparative more stably, superlative most stably)

description: From Middle English stablie, from Anglo-Norman stablie.

entries.meaning: (hunting, historical) A medieval hunting practice in which a group of hunters and hounds are stationed around the perimeter of a wood during a hunt to prevent the escape of the game.
examples: As described in chapter three, classic bow and stably hunting in the later Middle Ages and early Renaissance involved hunters waiting on foot at stands or stations for the driven quarry to appear within bowshot.
